oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MM-1981-103 Riley, 1807
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Samuel Riley
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: MM-1981-103 Samuel Riley’s testimony, 1807. August 11, 1807 testimony of Samuel Riley, interpreter, Hiwassee Garrison, re: disruption by Cherokees of Captain Armistead’s attempt to move prisoner James Chisholm on August 9, 1807. In the Cherokee Nation, near Walker’s Ferry. Mentions Cherokee Samuel Graves, Hanging Maw’s sons Willioa and Tom, James Rogers, Cotiquskee, the Ridge. ADS 2 pp.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: History; Indigenous peoples; Military personnel; Witnesses;
